instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00281 dead
threads.message:
The board is clean, no water damage at all.
However, the board is dead.

This is my first time working on this new board, i just got the schematics and looks a little bit different.

Any hint from where can i start look?

FB200 = 5V , however, i was supposed to get 20V, right?

Thanks

threads.title: 820-00281 dead
threads.message: Voltage on PP3v3_G3H? Always check PP3v3_G3H when you have 5 volts on DC in.

threads.title: 820-00281 dead
threads.message: Check PPBUS_G3H, PP3V3_G3H, SMC_BC_ACOK and SMC_RESET_L.

threads.title: 820-00281 dead
threads.message:
Ppbus_g3h - 0v / no short to ground


pp3v3_g3h - 0v
smc_bc_acoks - 0v
smc_reset_l - 0v

threads.title: 820-00281 dead
threads.message: Resistance to ground on PP3v3_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H for sure 5 volts steady?

threads.title: 820-00281 dead
threads.message:
If no short to ground at L6900, post U6903 voltages.
Also check resistance to ground at pin 2.

threads.title: 820-00281 dead
threads.message:
Pin 10 voltage needed too.
If present (3V), then change U5903.
If missing, post some voltage for U7000, P_IN, VDDA/P, AUX_DET.
